required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Endometrial Scratching for Cryopreserved Embryo Transfer
clinical_study.official_title: Endometrial Scratching for Cryopreserved Embryo Transfer: a Randomized Controlled Trial

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

brief_summary.textblock: Endometrial injury performed in a cycle preceding the one for embryo transfer is associated with an increased implantation and pregnancy rate when carried out during the month preceding that of ovulation induction and fresh embryo transfer. However, there is no evidence about the effect of this intervention on the transfer of cryopreserved embryos.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label

primary_outcome.description: The complete expulsion or extraction from its mother of a product of fertilization, irrespective of the duration of the pregnancy, which, after such separation, breathes or shows any other evidence of life, such as heart beat, umbilical cord pulsation, or definite movement of voluntary muscles, irrespective of whether the umbilical cord has been cut or the placenta is attached.

secondary_outcome.description: A pregnancy diagnosed by ultrasonographic visualization of one or more gestational sacs or definitive clinical signs of pregnancy. It includes ectopic pregnancy. Note: Multiple gestational sacs are counted as one clinical pregnancy.
The spontaneous loss of a clinical pregnancy

other_outcome.description: A pregnancy with more than one gestational sac.

arm_group.description: Women allocated to this group will be submitted to endometrial injury before undergoing endometrial preparation for embryo transfer.
Women allocated to this group will NOT be submitted to endometrial injury before undergoing endometrial preparation for embryo transfer.

intervention.description: Endometrial biopsy using a pipelle de Cornier

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18
- At least one cryopreserved embryo
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
